reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have just come back from a week at the Villa Aminta and I'm at a complete loss to understand the negative comments about this hotel. Sure, the furnishings are a bit over the top for UK taste and it is not very convenient if you want to stroll into Stresa but the hotel was lovingly restored to its original glory by the new owners (the Zanettas) in 2000 after a lot of research and it has been beautifully done at enormous cost. The public rooms are tasteful, if a bit ornate, and the rooms are very comfortable. On the small side, and again a bit ornate, but fitted out with state of the art electronics like flat screen TVs and the marble bathrooms with gold fittings function perfectly. The staff are as charming and helpful as any of the other 5-star hotels we stay in regularly and the food was excellent. The menu was varied, with good sized (not enormous) portions and the wine list also varied and affordable. Daniela, Clara and Alice are all very helpful and obliging at the front desk and the dining room staff, ably led by Vincenzo, are excellent. Elisa runs the bar with great charm and efficiency. The rooms on the side of the hotel over the front entrance get some muted train noise but they are double glazed and using the a/c cuts it out. As far as the trip to Stresa is concerned the hotel lays on a courtesy car to take guests in and bring them back six times a day, which is more than adequate for most needs. We look forward to going back.
reviews.title: In a class of its own

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were not sure what to expect at the Villa Aminta since neither of us had been to the Italian Lakes. It turned out to be fabulous! We flew into Milan Malpensa and rented a car for the drive to Stresa. It was an easy, 45 minute drive to beautiful Lake Maggiore. We had just done a lot of sightseeing in London and Paris so the laid back town of Stresa was just what we needed! We booked with American Express which included a deluxe breakfast with champagne, cheeses, and hot egg dishes. We spent a lot of time hanging out by the pool (which as other reviews mention, is freezing!). We also took a drive into Switzerland (about one hour). If you want an action packed tourist adventure Stresa is probably not for you. If you want to sleep late, eat great food and wine and just hang out Stresa is perfect.
reviews.title: A Truly Relaxing Place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is really ornate and beautiful. We had a balcony room overlooking the lake. It was cozy but large enough for two people. The bathroom was spacious and well equipped although the soaps and lotions were gross. The service in the hotel is a little stuffy and formal. We loved the food at breakfast but found dinner to be over priced and not very flavorful. We had a fantastic dinner at the Hotel Verbano, they pick you up by boat and take you across to the Island.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Villa Aminta has a nice view of the lake, but is situated on the main road with the railway line just behind - the rooms are rather noisy. The hotel is ornately decorated throughout, which may appeal to some people. There was a wedding taking place over the period of our stay which distracted staff away from other hotel guests' needs. In summary, the hotel and the hotel restaurant are both average and both over-priced. We stayed in 6 hotels throughout our stay in Italy and this was our least favourite.
